meanings.definition: A person or thing that repels or drives away something.
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow in the field acted as a repellers for the birds.
meanings.sent2: The strong smell of the repellent acted as a repellers for the mosquitoes.
meanings.sent3: The noisy dog was a great repellers for the burglars.
meanings.sent4: Her fierce determination was a repellers to any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The bright light served as a repellers to the darkness of the night.

meanings.definition: A device that emits sound waves to deter pests.
meanings.sent1: The ultrasonic repellers kept the mice away from the house.
meanings.sent2: The repellers emitted high-frequency sounds to scare off the insects.
meanings.sent3: The little gadget was like a tiny superhero, a repellers against unwanted critters.
meanings.sent4: The repellers hummed softly, creating a protective barrier around the garden.
meanings.sent5: The electronic repellers were like invisible shields, keeping pests at bay.

meanings.definition: A substance used to keep insects away.
meanings.sent1: She sprayed the natural repellers on the picnic blanket to ward off ants.
meanings.sent2: The citronella candle acted as a repellers against mosquitoes during the outdoor party.
meanings.sent3: The minty aroma of the repellers made the room smell fresh and bug-free.
meanings.sent4: The herbal repellers created an invisible force field that bugs dared not cross.
meanings.sent5: The powerful scent of the repellers filled the air, banishing insects from the room.
